component.name: ToggleGroup
component.description: Represent and manipulate a set of persistent on/off states using button-like controls.

commonPatterns.name: single-select-group
commonPatterns.description: Exactly one option active at a time (e.g., view switcher)
commonPatterns.composition:
<ToggleGroup type="single" defaultValue="grid">
  <ToggleGroupItem value="grid">
    <Grid className="size-4" />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value="list">
    <List className="size-4" />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
</ToggleGroup>

commonPatterns.name: multi-select-group
commonPatterns.description: Multiple options may be active simultaneously (e.g., text formatting)
commonPatterns.composition:
<ToggleGroup type="multiple">
  <ToggleGroupItem value="bold">
    <Bold className="size-4" />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value="italic">
    <Italic className="size-4" />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value="underline">
    <Underline className="size-4" />
  </ToggleGroupItem>
</ToggleGroup>

commonPatterns.name: sized-group
commonPatterns.description: Small toggle group for compact layouts
commonPatterns.composition:
<ToggleGroup type="single" size="sm" defaultValue="left">
  <ToggleGroupItem value="left">Left</ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value="center">Center</ToggleGroupItem>
  <ToggleGroupItem value="right">Right</ToggleGroupItem>
</ToggleGroup>

antiPatterns.reason: ToggleGroup manages persistent state, not one-off actions
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Button or ButtonGroup for action triggers

antiPatterns.scenario: Using ToggleGroup for page or content navigation
antiPatterns.reason: Navigation between sections has different semantics and accessibility expectations
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Tabs or Link for navigation

antiPatterns.scenario: Using ToggleGroup with more than 5-6 items
antiPatterns.reason: Too many visible options become hard to scan and consume excessive space
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Select for larger option sets

antiPatterns.scenario: Using ToggleGroup when selection requires confirmation
antiPatterns.reason: ToggleGroup state changes apply immediately; there is no submit step
antiPatterns.alternative: Use RadioGroup within a form for deferred selection

semanticMeaning.outline: Bordered items with subtle shadow; preferred for neutral state selection

slots.toggle-group: Root container; inline-flex with rounded corners; provides variant/size context
slots.toggle-group-item: Individual toggle button; inherits variant and size from group context

parentConstraints: ToggleGroupItem must be a direct child of ToggleGroup

stateModel.single: Exactly one option may be active at a time
stateModel.multiple: Multiple options may be active simultaneously

interactions.click: Toggles the clicked item; in single mode, deselects the previously active item
interactions.keyboard: Arrow keys navigate between items; Space/Enter toggles; Tab enters/exits group
interactions.hover: Background shifts to accent on hover
interactions.focus: Focused item gains z-index elevation and visible focus ring

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Arrow keys to navigate between items; Space/Enter to toggle; Tab to enter/exit group
accessibility.screenReader: Announces group label, each item label, and pressed state
accessibility.focusManagement: Roving focus within group; focused items gain z-10 elevation and focus ring

rules: ToggleGroup manages selection state â€” state changes apply immediately
All options are visible at once
Options should be limited to 5-6 items maximum
Toggle items visually resemble buttons but behave as stateful controls
Outline variant is preferred for neutral state selection
The variant prop is locked to outline at the group level

aiHints.context: Use ToggleGroup when the user should be able to see and change active states at a glance. Do not use for one-off actions (use ButtonGroup). If the choice affects content hierarchy or page sections, prefer Tabs. For more than 5-6 options, prefer Select.
